name: California Historical Society Collection at Stanford

episodes.title: Aerial views of Jonestown, Jim and Marceline Jones visiting Jonestown
episodes.description: Note: Leader section in film from 00:03:17-00:03:26. Description: Amateur movie recording an early visit of Jim and Marceline Jones to Jonestown, including footage of their arrival and of Jonestown residents promoting the settlement. Includes aerial views of Georgetown and Jonestown. Films like this were recorded by Peoples Temple to promote the agricultural mission and encourage migration to Jonestown. Source: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mm Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 3Rights: Copyrighted. Rights are owned by the CHS Collection at Stanford. Copyright Holder has given Institution permission to provide access to the digitized work online. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by copyright beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the Copyright Holder. In addition, the reproduction of some materials may be restricted by terms of gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owner. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user. For further information, please refer to the Permission to Publish or Broadcast Policy (https://library.stanford.edu/special-collections-policies) on the Stanford Special Collections website. Digitized by the California Audiovisual Preservation Project (CAVPP).

episodes.title: Jim Jones promoting Jonestown
episodes.description: Description: Amateur movie recording Jim Jones promoting Jonestown by showing and describing its amenities, including living quarters, cleared fields, chickens, generators, and power lines. Films like this were recorded by Peoples Temple to promote the agricultural mission and encourage migration to Jonestown. Source: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mm Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 32Rights: Copyrighted. episodes.title: Meeting of Guyanese officials and Jonestown residents
episodes.description: Note: Machine noise, conversation is inaudible. Description: Amateur movie recording a meeting of Guyanese officials and Jonestown residents, possibly in Port Kaituma, Guyana. Films like this were recorded by Peoples Temple to promote the agricultural mission and encourage migration to Jonestown. Source: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mm Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 38 Rights: Copyrighted. episodes.title: Jonestown children's parade

episodes.title: Jonestown schoolchildren, women making toys
episodes.description:
Description: Amateur movie recording Jonestown children at school, singing, and dancing, and women making dolls and stuffed animals. Also includes footage of Jonestown products, including wooden toys, children's games, and soap. Films like this were recorded by Peoples Temple to promote the agricultural mission and encourage migration to Jonestown.

Source: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mm Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 33Rights: Copyrighted. Rights are owned by the CHS Collection at Stanford. Copyright Holder has given Institution permission to provide access to the digitized work online. In addition, the reproduction of some materials may be restricted by terms of gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. episodes.title: Jim Jones promoting Jonestown
episodes.description: Note: Abrupt splices throughout. Tramlines, existing tape splices. Description: Amateur movie recording Jim Jones promoting Jonestown by showing and describing its amenities, including chicken coops, pastures, the piggery, warehouses, crops, living quarters, heavy machinery, and the radio tower. Includes footage of Jones interviewing Jonestown children, and Pop and Mom Jackson. Films like this were recorded by Peoples Temple to promote the agricultural mission and encourage migration to Jonestown. Source: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mm Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 2Rights: Copyrighted. Rights are owned by the CHS Collection at Stanford. Copyright Holder has given Institution permission to provide access to the digitized work online. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by copyright beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the Copyright Holder. In addition, the reproduction of some materials may be restricted by terms of gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. For further information, please refer to the Permission to Publish or Broadcast Policy (https://library.stanford.edu/special-collections-policies) on the Stanford Special Collections website.Digitized by the California Audiovisual Preservation Project (CAVPP).

episodes.title: Jonestown singer and band entertaining in pavilion
episodes.description: Note: No image in tail section. Description: Amateur movie recording singer Deanna Wilkinson and band performing a Jonestown-inspired version of the song "You are so beautiful to me" at the Jonestown pavilion. Films like this were recorded by Peoples Temple to promote the agricultural mission and encourage migration to Jonestown. Source: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mm Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 31Rights: Copyrighted. episodes.title: A People's Temple meeting with Jim Jones
episodes.description:
Please visit the California Revealed website to see the most complete and up-to-date version of this object: https://californiarevealed.org/node/346594.Description: Features Jim Jones presiding over a meeting, presumably in Redwood Valley. Members offer testimony and songs in praise of Jim Jones and the Lord.

Source: 1 Tape of 1: 3/4 inch videotape Collection: Media Resources Center Collection Call Number: VIDEO/C 2328Rights: Copyrighted. Rights are owned by UC Regents. episodes.title: Burning cut-down trees, children playing
episodes.description: Description: This silent, color film contains amateur movie footage of Peoples Temple members at the Peoples Temple Agricultural Mission in Jonestown, Guyana. The film begins with views of children at the mission near a playground area. The film then shows a group of children sitting on a pole as the forests nearby are being burned, likely for the expansion of the Peoples Temple area. The film shows the children casually sitting as the fire burns, and footage of the sky turning orange from the smoke.Collection Guide: Peoples Temple Publications Department RecordsSource: 1 Reel of 1: Film: Super 8mmCall Number: MS 3791; Film reel 21Rights: Copyrighted. Rights are owned by the CHS Collection at Stanford. Copyright Holder has given Institution permission to provide access to the digitized work online.
